DataElement.preferredName: Breast Imaging Procedure Performed Type Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded numeric response for the type of breast imaging procedure performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Edit to concept, released/reuse; tt.  3/28/14 curated to support 6702. tt

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Removal of tissue from the breast for microscopic examination._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._Numeric coded responses for breast imaging procedures.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Mammography that uses multiple X-ray pictures of each breast to produce a 3-dimensional rendering of the entire breast.

Concepts.definition: Mammography that uses multiple X-ray pictures of each breast to produce a 3-dimensional rendering of the entire breast.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: High frequency sound, generally with a frequency greater than 20,000 Hz.

Concepts.definition: High frequency sound, generally with a frequency greater than 20,000 Hz.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Examination by pressing on the surface of the body to feel the organs or tissues underneath.

Concepts.definition: A method of feeling with the hands during a physical examination. The health care provider touches and feels the patient's body to examine the size, consistency, texture, location and tenderness of an organ or body part.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An X-ray procedure using multiple coordinates to precisely determine the location of a tumor or nodule so as to obtain a tissue sample.

Concepts.definition: A biopsy procedure that uses 3-dimensional imaging to localize a lesion and guide the removal of a tissue sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Removal of tissue from the breast for microscopic examination.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Removal of tissue from the breast for microscopic examination.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
